thread.title: Somali native found badly beaten in Beltzhoover
thread.title_full: Somali native found badly beaten in Beltzhoover

author: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
title: Somali native found badly beaten in Beltzhoover
text:
Somali native found badly beaten in Beltzhoover February 22, 2017 9:36 PM Pittsburgh Post-Gazette 
A member of the local Somali Bantu community was critically injured early Tuesday after being beaten in Beltzhoover, police and advocates said. 
The victim, who is about 30, was found around 5 a.m. Tuesday in the 400 block of Climax Street and was taken to UPMC Presbyterian. 
Members of the local Somali Bantu and Muslim communities will hold a press conference with Pittsburgh police Thursday morning to address the beating. 
“They want to find out what happened,” said Betty Cruz, director of Change Agency, an immigrant advocacy group. “They want to make sure that this case gets treated the way it should.” 
What led to the assault remains unknown, however Ms. Cruz said some community members are fearful the assault was a hate crime. 
Ms. Cruz said the victim is a trusted, well-regarded member of the community. 
The Pittsburgh police Violent Crime Unit is investigating the beating.
